title: Ticket #2207: condor_read() failed: recv() returned -1, errno = 107 Transport endpoi
description:
The master occasionally complains: 

06/02/11 13:51:54 condor_read() failed: recv() returned -1, errno = 107 Transport endpoint is not connected, reading 4 bytes from .
06/02/11 13:51:54 condor_read() failed: recv() returned -1, errno = 107 Transport endpoint is not connected, reading 5 bytes from .
06/02/11 13:51:54 IO: Failed to read packet header
06/02/11 13:51:54 DaemonCore: Can't receive command request from  (perhaps a timeout?)

This may be a result of the IPv6 stage 2 merge; need to investigate the past.

This will sometimes bite other daemons as they start up; they'll fail to connect to the Master and will exit. Usually when the master restarts them, they are fine.

Typical complaints from a startd: 

06/02/11 14:41:42 condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 510 bytes to daemon at <128.105.185.14:34463>, fd is 8
06/02/11 14:41:42 Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
06/02/11 14:41:42 SECMAN: failed to end classad message
06/02/11 14:41:42 ChildAliveMsg: failed to send DC_CHILDALIVE to parent daemon at <128.105.185.14:34463> (try 1 of 3): SECMAN:2007:
Failed to end classad message.

This also bit the command line tools; the master rejected several commands in a row with errors like the above. After a while the problem cleared itself up. 

% condor_restart
ERROR
SECMAN:2007:Failed to end classad message.
Can't send Restart command to local master
% condor_restart
ERROR
SECMAN:2007:Failed to end classad message.
Can't send Restart command to local master
% condor_off -master
ERROR
SECMAN:2007:Failed to end classad message.
Can't send Kill-Daemon command to local master
remarks:
2011-Jun-02 14:39:44 by adesmet:
errno 107 = ENOTCONN. "The socket is associated with a connection-oriented protocol and has not been connected (see connect(2) and accept(2))."

2011-Jun-02 15:57:33 by adesmet:
Working theory: accept is failing in condor_accept (/src/condor_utils/condor_sockfunc.cpp 15). It's failing because len is being passed in uninitialized. It should be initialized to sizeof(sockaddr_storage).

2011-Jun-02 16:03:52 by adesmet:
Hahahahaha, condor_accept is never called, anywhere. Why it appeared in my backtrace is a mystery for the ages.

2011-Jun-02 16:18:50 by adesmet:
Ah, missed a change when I git pulled. 664ba4f1994652030555795e2c1123fb4b724ca0 (gthain's revert of m's change) removed the condor_accept. Probably as a quick fix to the core problem. I think my fix is more correct, need to check with gthain.

2011-Jun-22 14:48:28 by adesmet:
Fixed in [22264]
